page.title: 04PLACES OF WORSHIP CONTINUED
page.content: Saint Augustine's Church is a Church of England church and people who go there are Christians, who believe in God and Jesus. We sit on wooden benches called a pew and kneel on little cushions to pray. The vicar talks about our holy book, the Bible, which rests on a special stand called a lectern. When it is time for Sunday School the children leave the main part of the church and go to another room where we draw, paint and learn about God and have a Bible story. When we have finished we go back to the adults, have a cup of tea and go home.
